BR_text.BRsummary: When an st.slider is moved, the app reruns twice
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Run this script:
 import streamlit as st
 x = st.slider("Pick a number")
 print("You picked:", x)
 
 
 Move the slider from 0 to 42
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 In your terminal, you should see:
 <denchmark-code>You picked: 0
 You picked: 42
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
 
 In your terminal, you see:
 <denchmark-code>You picked: 0
 You picked: 0
 You picked: 42
 You picked: 42
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
 
 yes
 And it's very likely that I introduced this bug with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/pull/1834>this PR</denchmark-link>
